intro: Dorstenia nervosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. The varietal form angustifolia is distinguished by its narrower leaf blades compared to the typical species.
